textgrp.title: GENERAL NOTES
textgrp.para: This section contains illustrations and locations of missing items approved by the 747-400 Aircraft Flight Manual (AFM) Appendix Configuration Deviation List (CDL).

textgrp.title: GENERAL LIMITATIONS
textgrp.para: The associated limitations must be listed on a placard affixed in the cockpit in clear view of the Pilot-in-Command and other appropriate crew member(s).
Operation with those missing parts requiring a reduction of VMO /MMO is permitted only when the aircraft has the appropriate alternate VMO set prior to flight.
The Pilot-in-Command will be notified of each operation with a missing part(s) by listing the missing part(s) in the flight or dispatch release.
The operator will list in the aircraft Log an appropriate notation covering the missing part(s) on each flight.

If an additional part is lost in flight, the aircraft may not depart the airport at which it landed following this event until it again complies with CDL limitations. This, of course, does not preclude the issuance of a ferry permit to allow the aircraft to be flown to a point where the necessary repairs or replacements can be made.

No more than one part for any one sub-system may be missing unless specifically designated combinations are indicated herein. Unless otherwise specified herein, parts from different sub-systems may be missing.

textgrp.title: WEIGHT REDUCTIONS
textgrp.para: The performance decrements are cumulative. Where performance decrements are listed as negligible, no more than three negligible items may be missing without taking further decrement. For each missing item more than three, reduce the takeoff, landing and en route climb limits by 100 pounds. For items listed as not requiring any performance decrement, any accumulative number of items listed as not requiring any performance decrement may be missing without any further performance decrement.

textgrp.title: EN ROUTE FUEL MILEAGE EFFECTS
textgrp.para: The drag effects of many 747-400 CDL items are so small that en route fuel mileage changes are negligible. For items that have en route climb weight decrements listed, increase the flight planning fuel by 0.25% per 1000 lbs. of en route climb weight decrement to account for the en route drag increase.
